tit.j: 西本願寺本三十六人家集
tit.e: Nishi-Honganji-bon Sanju-rokunin-kashu (The Nishi Hongan-ji Collection of Thirty-Six Anthologies)
tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更、補足追加 (用語集参照)
tit.e: Nishi-Honganji-bon Sanju-rokunin-kashu (The Nishi Hongan-ji Collection of Thirty-Six Anthologies)

sen.j: 西本願寺本三十六人家集（にしほんがんじぼん さんじゅうろくにんかしゅう）は、三十六歌仙の和歌を集めた平安時代末期の装飾写本である。
sen.e: Nishi-Honganji-bon sanju-rokunin-kashu is a decorative manuscript produced in the end of Heian Period that compiled the poems of sanju-rokkasen (thirty-six famous poets).
Nishi-Honganji-bon sanju-rokunin-kashu is a decorative manuscript produced at the end of the Heian period that compiled the poems of Sanju-rokkasen (thirty-six famous poets).
sen.cmt: in the end of Heian Period→at the end of the Heian periodに修正、Sanju-rokkasenとしました。
sen.e: Nishi-Honganji-bon sanju-rokunin-kashu is a decorative manuscript produced at the end of the Heian period that compiled the poems of Sanju-rokkasen (thirty-six famous poets).

sen.j: 三十六人家集のまとまった写本としては最古のもので、国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: It is the oldest one among the manuscripts of poems of sanju-rokkasen, and it was designated as national treasure.
It is the oldest one among the manuscripts of poems of Sanju-rokkasen, and it is designated as a national treasure.
sen.cmt: Sanju-rokkasenとし、was→is、national treasure→a national treasureに修正
sen.e: It is the oldest one among the manuscripts of poems of Sanju-rokkasen, and it is designated as a national treasure.

sen.j: 京都市・西本願寺（浄土真宗本願寺派本願寺）の所蔵。
sen.e: It is being possessed by Nishi Hongan-ji Temple (Hongan-ji Temple, Hongan-ji school of Jodo-shin Sect) in Kyoto.
It is being possessed by Nishi Hongan-ji Temple (Hongan-ji Temple, Hongan-ji school of Jodo Shinshu sect [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]) in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「浄土真宗」→統一リストの表記に修正、Kyoto→Kyoto Cityに修正
sen.e: It is being possessed by Nishi Hongan-ji Temple (Hongan-ji Temple, Hongan-ji school of Jodo Shinshu sect [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]) in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 三十六歌仙の和歌を歌仙別に1帖ないし2帖の冊子としたものである。
sen.e: One or two books are allotted to each of sanju-rokkasen for their poems.
One or two books are allotted to each of Sanju-rokkasen for their poems.
One or two books are allotted to each of Sanju-rokkasen for their poems.

sen.j: 柿本人麻呂集、紀貫之集、大中臣能宣集については上下2帖構成とするため、全体では39帖からなる。
sen.e: It consists of 39 books intotal since the collection of KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro, KI no Tsurayuki and ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu were allotted two books for each.
It consists of 39 books in total since the collection of KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro, KI no Tsurayuki and ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu were allotted two books for each.
It consists of 39 books in total since the collection of KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro, KI no Tsurayuki and ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu were allotted two books for each.

sen.j: このうち、伊勢 (歌人)集と貫之集下は1929年に冊子の形を解体して一葉ずつの断簡に分割された。
sen.e: Among them, the collections of Ise (poet) and Tsurayuki were split into dankan (fragmentary pieces of a book) in 1929.
Among them, the collections of Ise (poet) and Tsurayuki were split into dankan (fragmentary pieces of a book) in 1929.
Among them, the collections of Ise (poet) and Tsurayuki were split into dankan (fragmentary pieces of a book) in 1929.

sen.j: これらの断簡は本願寺の旧所在地にちなんで「石山切」（いしやまぎれ）と名付けられ、掛軸などに改装されて各地の美術館や収集家に分蔵されている。
sen.e: These dankan were named "Ishiyamagire" after the name of place where Hongan-ji Temple was located previously, and they are being possessed by museums and collectors across the nation in the form of hanging scroll etc.

These dankan were named 'Ishiyamagire' after the name of place where Hongan-ji Temple was located previously, and they are being possessed by museums and collectors across the nation in the form of hanging scroll etc.

sen.e: These dankan were named 'Ishiyamagire' after the name of place where Hongan-ji Temple was located previously, and they are being possessed by museums and collectors across the nation in the form of hanging scroll etc.

sen.j: 西本願寺に所蔵されるのは、平安時代（1110年頃）の原本が32帖、鎌倉時代の補写本が1帖（藤原兼輔）、江戸時代の補写本が4帖（人麻呂集上・下、在原業平集、小野小町集）、1929年（昭和4年）頃の田中親美（たなかしんび）の復元模写本が2帖である。
sen.e: Nishi Hongan-ji Temple possesses 32 books of original manuscript produced in the Heian period (around 1110), one book of supplemental manuscript (FUJIWARA no KANESUKE) produced in the Kamakura period, four books of supplemental manuscript (volume 1 and 2 of Hitomaro' Collection, ARIWARA no Narihira's Collection, ONO no Komachi's Collection) produced in the Edo period and two restored copied books drawn by Shinbi TANAKA around in 1929.

sen.j: 昭和の補写本2冊を除く37帖が、付属の後奈良天皇宸翰女房奉書1幅と共に国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: 37 books other than two books drawn in the Showa era were designated as national treasure together with "Imperial letter of the Emperor Gonara nyobo hosho ("hosho" is a letter sent by the Court ladies by imperial order)".

37 books other than two books drawn in the Showa era are designated as a national treasure together with a scroll of "Imperial letter of the Emperor Gonara nyobo hosho" ("nyobo hosho" is a letter sent by the Court ladies by imperial order).
sen.cmt: 「1幅」→訳漏れのため訳出、were→are、national treasure→a national treasure、"hosho"→"nyobo hosho"とし、クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: 37 books other than two books drawn in the Showa era are designated as a national treasure together with a scroll of "Imperial letter of the Emperor Gonara nyobo hosho" ("nyobo hosho" is a letter sent by the Court ladies by imperial order).

sen.j: 体裁は縦約20cm、幅約16cmの紙本で、装丁は粘葉装（でっちょうそう）。
sen.e: It is a 20cm-by-16cm paper book, and deccho-so (a kind of binding technique) was employed for binding.
It is a 20cm-by-16cm paper book, and detcho-so (a kind of binding technique) was employed for binding.
It is a 20cm-by-16cm paper book, and detcho-so (a kind of binding technique) was employed for binding.

sen.j: 各帖には彩色下絵、金銀の箔、雲母（きら）刷りの地紋、墨流し、破り継ぎなど、あらゆる料紙装飾技法が駆使されている。
sen.e: Every and all paper decoration techniques, such as colored preliminary sketch, gold leaf and silver leaf, mica-printed jimon (textile pattern), suminagashi (pattern made with ink drop) and yaburitsugi (Heian-style collage technique to decorate poetry sheets), were employed in producing each book.

sen.j: 伝世した平安時代の装飾写本の中で、最も豪華な装飾が施されたものの一つである。
sen.e: It is one of the most luxurious one among the existent decorated manuscripts produced in the Heian period.
It is one of the most luxurious ones among the existent decorated manuscripts produced in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: one of the most luxurious one→one of the most luxurious onesとしました。
sen.e: It is one of the most luxurious ones among the existent decorated manuscripts produced in the Heian period.

sen.j: 表紙は紗を芯にした羅（絹）で、現在は紙を入れて補強してある。
sen.e: Its cover is made of silk with gauze-made padding, and it is being reinforced by paper at present.
Its cover is made of silk with gauze-made padding, and it is being reinforced by paper at present.
Its cover is made of silk with gauze-made padding, and it is being reinforced by paper at present.

sen.j: 表紙の羅にも主として銀泥で山水画が描かれている。
sen.e: Chinese-style landscape painting was drawn mainly with silver paint on the silk used for its cover.
Chinese-style landscape painting was drawn mainly with silver paint on the silk used for its cover.

sen.j: 制作事情については、天永3年（1112年）の白河天皇の六十の賀に際して宮廷で制作されたと推定されている。
sen.e: It is surmised that it was produced in 1112 by the Imperial Court in celebration of the 60th birthday of the Emperor Shirakawa.
It is surmised that it was produced in 1112 by the Imperial Court in celebration of the 60th birthday of the Emperor Shirakawa.

sen.j: その後長らく宮中に伝来したが、天文18年（1549年）に後奈良天皇から本願寺証如に与えられた。
sen.e: It had been kept at the Imperial Court for long since then, and the Emperor Gonara gave it to Shonyo of Hongan-Temple in 1549.
It had been kept at the Imperial Court for long since then, and the Emperor Gonara gave it to Shonyo of Hongan-ji Temple in 1549.

sen.j: 国宝の付属指定とされている「後奈良天皇宸翰女房奉書」はこの伝来に関わる資料である。
sen.e: "Imperial letter of the Emperor Gonara nyobo hosho", which was also designated as national treasure, is material concerning the above history.
Imperial letter of the Emperor Gonara nyobo hosho,' which is also designated as a national treasure, is material concerning the above history.
